definition: to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to separate/to divide/to analyze

sentences.english: Without the Han China could never have held together.
sentences.chinese: 沒有了漢民族中國早就分崩離析了。

sentences.english: America's auto titans are dismantling their global empires.
sentences.chinese: 美國汽車業巨頭的全球汽車王國正經歷着分崩離析。

sentences.english: The war has changed a disunited country into a relatively united one.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭使全國分崩離析的局面變成了比較團結的局面。

sentences.english: Then, like Wylie Coyote, I hit the wall and my life fell apart.
sentences.chinese: 然後，像衛理狼，我打在牆上，我的生活分崩離析。

sentences.english: Do not experience the pain of fall, who will care tempestuous waves of Qingning?
sentences.chinese: 不經歷分崩離析的痛苦，誰會在意驚濤駭浪的清寧？

sentences.english: That you have hours to attenuate these characters and layer them.
sentences.chinese: 你有大把時間來將這些角色搞得分崩離析。

sentences.english: Which brings me to the case of the collapsing crisis commission.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我聯想起了正在分崩離析的危機委員會。

sentences.english: The dissolution of the Guccione empire took years.
sentences.chinese: 數年之間，古奇奧尼帝國分崩離析。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
misconception/fallacy
the enemy and us
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
unification and independence
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
feudalism
prison/jail
